title: Odd quirky Italian Display Face what is it?
content:
this one has odd counters. I know its kind of a whacky face but it works in the context of how i’m using it. anyone have any idea?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 17.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2017_2.png) | 23.1 KB |

 [‹ what is this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47017 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please help ID this mystery font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46996 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bob Loblaw

comments.content:
Looks very quirky. Perhaps old wood type?

You might like [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Rhode)from Font Bureau. You might also like [Knockout No. 94 Ultimate Sumo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100013) or [Leviathan Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100015) or [Champion Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100002) all from Hoefler & Frere-Jones. Oh and [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/inuse.html) from Process Type Foundry has a very nice black weight and is a little quirky too.
thanks! champion gothic was my backup if i couldnt get any other suggestions. but the rhode has some similar characteristics that may work as well. I appreciate the help.
And there you go. One more I always forget about.
marcox, youre right that is quite similar, i think im still going to go with Knockout Sumo or Champion as both have several weights.
In that case you might like [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011010731/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=rhode&sample_text=CURIOSITA) as well.
